data.title: Scotland considers legally enshrining the 'right to food': '...it would mean the Government and other public bodies would have a duty to ensure everyone has secure access to adequate and affordable food.'
Slovenia adds water to constitution as fundamental right for all

Scientists have identified an antibody that neutralises 98% of HIV strains - "When the researchers exposed N6 to 181 different strains of HIV, it managed to destroy 98 percent of them, including 16 of 20 strains resistant to other antibodies of the same class."
Brexit: Fresh blow for Theresa May as Supreme Court rules Scotland and Wales can intervene in Article 50 triggering

Scientists have developed a synthetic way to absorb CO2 that's way faster than plants - ""ECRs are supercharged enzymes that are capable of fixing CO2 at the rate of nearly 20 times faster than the most widely prevalent CO2-fixing enzyme in nature..."
ISIS teenage 'Cub of the Caliphate' kills his entire family after his suicide belt accidentally goes off at home in Mosul
Nearly 50 countries vow to use 100% renewable energy by 2050: The signatories are countries who are disproportionately affected by global warming such as Ethiopia and the Maldives
Global green movement prepares to fight Trump on climate change
SpaceX Wants to Launch 4,425 Satellites Into Orbit. Allowing internet access to the entire planet.
